meanings.definition: To withdraw from a promise or agreement.
meanings.sent1: She resiled from her promise to help with the project.
meanings.sent2: He resiled from the agreement at the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The cat resiled from its promise to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The sun resiled from the sky as the storm approached.
meanings.sent5: The student resiled from his commitment to study every day.

meanings.definition: To retract or recant a statement.
meanings.sent1: He resiled his earlier statement about the movie being boring.
meanings.sent2: She resiled her comment after realizing it was incorrect.
meanings.sent3: The dog resiled its bark when it saw its own reflection.
meanings.sent4: The politician resiled his promise to lower taxes.
meanings.sent5: The child resiled his claim of seeing a ghost in the attic.

meanings.definition: To step back or retreat from a position.
meanings.sent1: The team resiled from their aggressive stance to a more defensive one.
meanings.sent2: She resiled from her position as team captain.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel resiled from the top branch to a lower one.
meanings.sent4: The company resiled from its decision to expand globally.
meanings.sent5: The soldier resiled from the front lines to regroup with the squad.
